Summary: TYPE CONSTANT FUNCTION
fgl_svg_chart

fglsvgchart

Genero SVG Chart Library

This library provides a set of functions to produce SVG charts. Before using this library, you need to know how to use fglsvgcanvas.4gl.

TYPE Summary
public t_data_item RECORD
public t_dataset RECORD
public t_value RECORD

CONSTANT Summary
public CHART_TYPE_BARS INTEGER
public CHART_TYPE_LINES INTEGER

public LEGEND_POS_RIGHT INTEGER
public LEGEND_POS_TOP INTEGER

Types

t_data_item

public TYPE t_data_item RECORD
    
position DECIMAL
title STRING
values DYNAMIC ARRAY OF t_value
END RECORD

t_dataset

public TYPE t_dataset RECORD
    
label STRING
style STRING
visible BOOLEAN
END RECORD

t_value

public TYPE t_value RECORD
    
value DECIMAL
label STRING
value2 DECIMAL
label2 STRING
point BOOLEAN
END RECORD

public CONSTANT CHART_TYPE_LINES INTEGER = 3

Functions

clean

public FUNCTION clean(id SMALLINT)

Remove all data items from the chart.

Call this function to clean the data of the chart.

 CALL fglsvgchart.clean(id)

Parameters:
id - The chart id

create

public FUNCTION create(name STRING) RETURNS SMALLINT

Create a new chart and return an ID

This function creates a new chart object and returns its ID. The chart ID will be used in other functions to identify a chart object.

 DEFINE id SMALLINT
 LET id = fglsvgchart.create("mychart")

Parameters:
name - The name of the chart.
Returns:
The chart object ID
The chart object ID

defineDataItem

public FUNCTION defineDataItem(id SMALLINT, itemidx SMALLINT, position DECIMAL, title STRING)

Define a new data item to the chart with a single value.

 CALL fglsvgchart.defineDataItem(id, 10, 15.34, "January")

Parameters:
id - The chart id
itemidx - The index of the data item
position - The data position (X-axis)
title - The text to display at the base of the item

defineDataSet

public FUNCTION defineDataSet(id SMALLINT, index SMALLINT, label STRING, style STRING)

Define a new data set.

 CALL fglsvgchart.defineDataSet(id, 1, "North",      "style_1")
 CALL fglsvgchart.defineDataSet(id, 2, "North-East", "style_2")
 CALL fglsvgchart.defineDataSet(id, 3, "North-West", "style_3")

Parameters:
id - The chart id
index - The index of the data set
label - The text to display at the base of the item
style - The general style to render data items

defineGrid

public FUNCTION defineGrid(id SMALLINT, nx SMALLINT, ny SMALLINT)

Set the number of horizontal and vertical grid lines to display.

The style of the grid can be defined with "grid", the line styles can be defined with "grid_x_line_x" and "grid_y_line", the style for X/Y axises can be defined with "grid_x_axis" and "grid_y_axis".

 CALL fglsvgchart.defineGrid(id, 12, 40)

Parameters:
id - The chart id
nx - The number of horizontal lines.
ny - The number of vertival lines.

destroy

public FUNCTION destroy(id SMALLINT)

Destroy a chart object

This function releases all resources allocated for the chart.

Parameters:
id - The chart id

finalize

public FUNCTION finalize()

Library finalization function.

This function has to be called when the library is not longer used.

getDataItemCount

public FUNCTION getDataItemCount(id SMALLINT) RETURNS INTEGER

Returns the current number of data items in the chart.

Parameters:
id - The chart id
Returns:
The number of data items.
The number of data items.

getDataItemPosition

public FUNCTION getDataItemPosition(id SMALLINT, itemidx SMALLINT) RETURNS DECIMAL

Get the data item position.

 DISPLAY fglsvgchart.getDataItemPosition(id, 1)

Parameters:
id - The chart id
itemidx - The index of the item.
Returns:
The position of the item.
The position of the item.

getDataItemValue

public FUNCTION getDataItemValue(id SMALLINT, itemidx SMALLINT, dataidx SMALLINT) RETURNS DECIMAL

Get the main value from an existing data item.

 DISPLAY fglsvgchart.getDataItemValue(id, 5, 1)

Parameters:
id - The chart id
itemidx - The index of the item.
dataidx - The index of the data set.
Returns:
The primary value of the item.
The primary value of the item.

public FUNCTION getDataItemValue2(id SMALLINT, itemidx SMALLINT, dataidx SMALLINT) RETURNS DECIMAL

 DISPLAY fglsvgchart.getDataItemValue2(id, 5, 1)

Parameters:
id - The chart id

dataidx - The index of the data set.
Returns:
The secondary value of the item.

getDataSetCount

public FUNCTION getDataSetCount(id SMALLINT) RETURNS INTEGER

Returns the current number of datasets in the chart.

Parameters:
id - The chart id
Returns:
The number of datasets.
The number of datasets.

initialize

public FUNCTION initialize()

Library initialization function.

This function has to be called before using other functions of this module.

render

public FUNCTION render(id SMALLINT, type SMALLINT, parent om.DomNode, x STRING, y STRING, width STRING, height STRING)

Render the chart in your web component.

 CALL fglsvgchart.render(id, CHART_TYPE_BARS, svg_root_node, NULL,NULL,"10em","10em" )

Parameters:
id - The chart id
type - The type of chart, can be: CHART_TYPE_BARS, CHART_TYPE_POINTS, CHART_TYPE_LINES
parent - The parent svg om.DomNode where the chart svg node must be created.
x - The X position (in the parent svg node).
y - The Y position (in the parent svg node).
width - The width (in the parent svg node).
height - The height (in the parent svg node).

reset

public FUNCTION reset(id SMALLINT)

Reset chart datasets.

Call this function to reset the chart by deleting all datasets.

 CALL fglsvgchart.reset(id)

Parameters:
id - The chart id

setBoundaries

public FUNCTION setBoundaries(id SMALLINT, minpos DECIMAL, maxpos DECIMAL, minval DECIMAL, maxval DECIMAL)

Defines the coordinate limits of the chart

Sets the lower and upper limits of the chart coordinate system.

 CALL fglsvgchart.setBoundaries(cid, -400, 1200, 0, 5000)

Parameters:
id - The chart id
minpos - The lower limit for positions (X-axis)
maxpos - The upper limit for positions (X-axis)
minval - The lower limit for values (Y-axis)
maxval - The upper limit for values (Y-axis)

setDataItemValue

public FUNCTION setDataItemValue(id SMALLINT, itemidx SMALLINT, dataidx SMALLINT, value DECIMAL, label STRING)

Set the main value and label of an existing data item.

The data item must have been created with the defineDataItem() function.

 DEFINE x SMALLINT
 LET x = 0
 CALL fglsvgchart.defineDataItem(id, x:=x+1, 15.34, "January")
 CALL fglsvgchart.setDataItemValue(id, x, 1, 30.15, "Jan1")
 CALL fglsvgchart.setDataItemValue(id, x, 2, 45.25, "Jan2")
 CALL fglsvgchart.setDataItemValue(id, x, 3, 15.57, "Jan3")
 CALL fglsvgchart.setDataItemValue(id, x, 4, 40.15, "Jan4")

Parameters:
id - The chart id
itemidx - The index of the item.
dataidx - The index of the data set.
value - The data value (Y-axis)
label - The test to display at the value / point

setDataItemValue2

public FUNCTION setDataItemValue2(id SMALLINT, itemidx SMALLINT, dataidx SMALLINT, value DECIMAL, label STRING)

Set the secondary value and label of an existing data item.

The data item must have been created with the defineDataItem() function.

 DEFINE x SMALLINT
 LET x = 0
 CALL fglsvgchart.defineDataItem(id, x:=x+1, 15.34, "January")
 CALL fglsvgchart.setDataItemValue2(id, x, 1, 30.15, "Jan1")
 CALL fglsvgchart.setDataItemValue2(id, x, 2, 45.25, "Jan2")
 CALL fglsvgchart.setDataItemValue2(id, x, 3, 15.57, "Jan3")
 CALL fglsvgchart.setDataItemValue2(id, x, 4, 40.15, "Jan4")

Parameters:
id - The chart id
itemidx - The index of the item.
dataidx - The index of the data set.
value - The data value (Y-axis)
label - The test to display at the value / point

setGridLabelX

public FUNCTION setGridLabelX(id SMALLINT, index SMALLINT, label STRING)

Set grid labels for X axis.

 CALL fglsvgchart.setGridLabelX(id, 12, "December")

Parameters:
id - The chart id
index - The position of the label
label - The text of the label

setGridLabelY

public FUNCTION setGridLabelY(id SMALLINT, index SMALLINT, label STRING)

Set grid labels for Y axis.

 CALL fglsvgchart.setGridLabelY(id, 5, "50%")

Parameters:
id - The chart id
index - The position of the label
label - The text of the label

setGridLabelsFromStepsX

public FUNCTION setGridLabelsFromStepsX(id SMALLINT, skip SMALLINT, format STRING)

Set grid labels for X axis from grid steps.

 CALL fglsvgchart.setGridLabelsFromStepsX(id,2,"---&.&&%")

Parameters:
id - The chart id
skip - The number of steps to skip
format - The USING format to create the text

setGridLabelsFromStepsY

public FUNCTION setGridLabelsFromStepsY(id SMALLINT, skip SMALLINT, format STRING)

Set grid labels for Y axis from grid steps.

 CALL fglsvgchart.setGridLabelsFromStepsY(id,2,"---&.&&%")

Parameters:
id - The chart id
skip - The number of steps to skip
format - The USING format to create the text

setRectangularRatio

public FUNCTION setRectangularRatio(id SMALLINT, ratio DECIMAL)

Defines the rectangular ratio of the chart

When the positions and values ranges differe too much, use this funciton to apply an aspect ration, and produce a readable chart. The ratio will be applied to values to determine the coordinate of the value item in the chart grid. For example, if the positions go from -100 to 100 and the values fo from -1 to 1, you can apply a ratio of 20.0, so that value 0.5 will be displayed at 0.5*50.0 = 25.0 ...

 CALL fglsvgchart.setRectangularRatio(cid, 35.0)

Parameters:
id - The chart id
ratio - The ratio to apply for this chart

setTitle

public FUNCTION setTitle(id SMALLINT, title STRING)

Defines the chart main title

 CALL fglsvgchart.setTitle(cid, "My chart")

Parameters:
id - The chart id
title - The lower limit for positions (X-axis)

showDataItemPoint

public FUNCTION showDataItemPoint(id SMALLINT, itemidx SMALLINT, dataidx SMALLINT, enable BOOLEAN)

Defines if a point must be displayed for this data item.

By default, when the global setting for points display is true, all data items get a points. You can control data items level points display with this function.

 CALL fglsvgchart.showDataItemPoint(id, 5, 3, FALSE)

Parameters:
id - The chart id
itemidx - The index of the item.
dataidx - The index of the data set.
enable - TRUE to display the data item point

showDataSet

public FUNCTION showDataSet(id SMALLINT, index SMALLINT, enable STRING)

Display dataset

Parameters:
id - The chart id
index - The dataset index
enable - TRUE to display the dataset

showDataSetLegend

public FUNCTION showDataSetLegend(id SMALLINT, position SMALLINT)

Display dataset legend

Defines the position of the legend box.

Parameters:
id - The chart id
position - NULL or LEGEND_POS_{TOP|LEFT|BOTTOM|RIGHT}

showGridPositionLabels

public FUNCTION showGridPositionLabels(id SMALLINT, enable BOOLEAN)

Display position-axis labels

Parameters:
id - The chart id
enable - TRUE to display the labels

showGridValueLabels

public FUNCTION showGridValueLabels(id SMALLINT, enable BOOLEAN)

Display value-axis labels

Parameters:
id - The chart id
enable - TRUE to display the labels

showOrigin

public FUNCTION showOrigin(id SMALLINT, enable BOOLEAN)

Display X/Y axis

Parameters:
id - The chart id
enable - TRUE to display the axis

showPoints

public FUNCTION showPoints(id SMALLINT, enable BOOLEAN, style STRING)

Display points

Parameters:
id - The chart id
enable - TRUE to display points
style - SVG style for points, NULL= use dataset style.

showValueLabels

public FUNCTION showValueLabels(id SMALLINT, enable BOOLEAN)

Display value labels

Parameters:
id - The chart id
enable - TRUE to display the value labels
